result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott J Chesniak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

The defendant shall provide a DNA sample within 30 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott J Chesniak

Def in person & by Atty Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.   Clerk: MS; Case passed to allow pending Br. 3 case to be brought to court; Case recalled, same appearances.  On a plea to Ct. 2, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 1 and 14CF292, State submits Stip for 14TR1963, 14TR1964, 14TR1965, Court executes same/copies provided. Free to argue; Court questions Def re: PQ; Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2, Court questions def, accepts plea and finds def guilty of Ct. 2, on motion of the state Court dismisses ct 1 & 14CF292 for read in; Argument from the State, Counsel; Court proceeds to sentencing.
Arraignment on July 21, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Mark A Schoenfeldt.  Atty Sandra J Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement has not been reached.  Court allows one more opportunity to resolve - if not resolved at next hearing, trial to be set.  ARGN adj.  Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Arraignment on June 11, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Mark A Schoenfeldt.  Atty Peter J Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Matter was set for preliminary hearing, however, def now waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def and accepts waiver.  State files and Court reviews Information w/def.  If case does not resolve at next hearing, trial will be set.  Counsel req bond modification; Court denies request and keeps bond as previously set, $750 cash.  Arraignment scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
